revised_title: Morphology and Response Characteristics of Olfactory Interneurons in the Moth Manduca Sexta
tldr: The study investigates the antennal lobes of the moth Manduca sexta, focusing on the two distinct classes of central neurons: local interneurons and output neurons. The research reveals that male moths have a male-specific neuropil region called the macroglomerular complex, which contains dendritic branches of pheromone-sensitive local interneurons and output neurons. This discovery provides insights into the olfactory mechanisms of insects and their role in behavior.
